parts.text: Develop an institutional trading platform with real-time market data feeds, advanced order management systems, comprehensive portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities and derivatives, and real-time P&L calculations

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a GitOps practice, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

I've popped up the options below for you to choose the language and repository strategy. Since we're building an institutional trading platform with real-time data, advanced order management, portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities and derivatives, and real-time P&L calculations, selecting the right language and repo strategy will determine the template and branch workflow I initialize.

Please select one of the options shown.

args.question: Which repository and language strategy would you like to use for the institutional trading platform build?
args.context: Since we're building an institutional trading platform with real-time market data feeds, advanced order management, portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance, and real-time P&L, choose the language and repository strategy so I can initialize the project repository using Cyoda's GitOps templates.

options.label: Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch
Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch
Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch
Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch
